org.apache.edgent.samples.utils.sensor

Class SimulatedTemperatureSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.edgent.samples.utils.sensor.SimulatedTemperatureSensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Supplier<java.lang.Double>

    public class SimulatedTemperatureSensor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Supplier<java.lang.Double>
    A Simulated temperature sensor.

    The sensor starts off with an initial value. Each call to get() changes the current value by a random amount between plus/minus a deltaFactor. The new current value is limited to a tempRange and then rounded to 1 fractional digit.

    No temperature scale is implied (e.g., Fahrenheit, Kelvin, ...). The double temperature values are simply generated as described. The user of the class decides how to interpret them.

    Sample use: 

    
 Topology t = ...;
 SimulatedTemperatureSensor tempSensor = new SimulatedTemperatureSensor();
 TStream<Double> temp = t.poll(tempSensor, 1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
    See Also:
    SimpleSimulatedSensor, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimulatedTemperatureSensor

        public SimulatedTemperatureSensor()
        Create a temperature sensor.

        Same as SimulatedTemperatureSensor(80.0, Ranges.closed(28.0, 112.0), 1.0)

        These default values roughly correspond to normal air temperature in the Fahrenheit scale.

      • SimulatedTemperatureSensor

        public SimulatedTemperatureSensor(double initialTemp,
                                  Range<java.lang.Double> tempRange,
                                  double deltaFactor)
        Create a temperature sensor.

        No temperature scale is implied.

        Parameters:
        initialTemp - the initial temperature. Must be within tempRange.
        tempRange - maximum sensor value range
        deltaFactor - maximum plus/minus change on each get(). e.g., 1.0 to limit change to +/- 1.0. Must be > 0.0
